title: Football regulator: UK government confirms new independent body
description: Blocking clubs from joining a breakaway European Super League will be among the powers held by English football's new independent regulator.

title: RB Leipzig 1-1 Manchester City: Riyad Mahrez scores but Pep Guardiola's side held
description: Manchester City pay the price for failing to make the most of their first-half dominance as they are held by RB Leipzig in the first leg of their Champions League last-16 tie.

title: Inter Milan 1-0 Porto: Romelu Lukaku scores only goal in Champions League last-16 first-leg tie
description: Substitute Romelu Lukaku scores the only goal as Inter Milan beat 10-man Porto in the first leg of their Champions League last-16 tie.

title: Brazil landslides: 'I knew most of the people buried'
description: More than 40 people have been killed in landslides which hit coastal towns in Brazil's São Paulo state.

title: Selfie image shows US pilot flying over Chinese 'spy balloon'
description: The image, shot from the plane cockpit, reportedly has "legendary status" within the Pentagon

title: England 6-1 Belgium: Lionesses retain Arnold Clark Cup with win over Belgium
description: England successfully defend the Arnold Clark Cup after a thumping victory over Belgium makes it three wins from three games in the tournament.

title: Omagh: Off-duty police officer shot
description: The incident happened in Omagh, County Tyrone on Wednesday evening.

title: Rapper Nipsey Hussle's killer Eric R Holder Jr gets 60 years in prison
description: Eric R. Holder, Jr. receives 60 years to life for the murder of the Grammy-nominated rapper in LA.

title: Ukraine war: Big mistake for Russia to suspend nuclear arms treaty, Biden says
description: On Tuesday President Putin said Moscow would suspend participation in the New Start treaty.

title: Asylum claims for 12,000 to be considered without face-to-face interview
description: The Home Office is to scrap face-to-face interviews for asylum seekers from five countries.

title: Qatar Open: Andy Murray beats Alexander Zverev to reach quarter-finals
description: Andy Murray continues his eventful start to the season with a notable win over Germany's Alexander Zverev to put him into the Qatar Open quarter-finals.

title: Eleven Palestinians killed during Israeli raid in Nablus
description: More than 80 people also suffer bullet wounds after troops surround a house with militants inside.

title: Suella Braverman plays down resignation talk over Brexit
description: But the home secretary says she won't support any protocol deal that "sells out" Northern Ireland.

title: Hannah Cockroft: Briton sets fourth world record in three days
description: British wheelchair racer Hannah Cockroft sets a fourth world record in three days while competing in her season-opening events.

title: Six Nations 2023: Wales will play match against England despite player unrest
description: Wales' Six Nations match against England in Cardiff will go ahead after the Welsh players decided to play.

title: European Indoor Championships: Keely Hodgkinson and Laura Muir in Great Britain team
description: Keely Hodgkinson and Laura Muir are named in Great Britain and Northern Ireland's team for the European Indoor Championships.

title: Women's T20 World Cup: India unfazed by semi-final against 'unstoppable train' Australia
description: India are looking to upset defending champions Australia in the semi-final of the T20 World Cup in South Africa.

title: Conor Benn: British boxer back in WBC rankings after failed drugs test not 'intentional'
description: Conor Benn is reinstated to the WBC rankings as it rules his failed drugs test was not 'intentional' and could have been caused be the overconsumption of eggs.

title: Ukraine war: China's claim to neutrality fades with Moscow visit
description: Beijing sees the Kremlin's war as serving a useful geopolitical purpose by confronting US influence.

title: Number of people never married rises, census shows
description: Official figures reveal nearly four in 10 adults in England and Wales have never been married.

title: Child abuse material found on VR headsets, police data shows
description: Virtual reality technology is exposing children to new risks online, the NSPCC warns.

title: Teacher strikes will go ahead if no pay progress
description: The union says it would only pause next week's strikes if the government offers a "serious proposal".

title: Police handling of Nicola Bulley search to be reviewed
description: Lancashire Police received a backlash for revealing personal details about the missing mother.

title: Novak Djokovic: World number one hopeful of 'positive' decision on US tournaments
description: World number one Novak Djokovic says he is hoping for a "positive decision" to allow him to play at Indian Wells and the Miami Open next month.

title: Ethnic minority Covid death gap closes – ONS
description: Data shows ethnic minorities are no longer more likely to die from the virus than white people .

title: Liam Smith: WBO order Janibek Alimkhanuly to defend his middleweight title against the British mandatory challenger
description: The WBO has ordered Janibek Alimkhanuly to defend his middleweight world title against Briton Liam Smith.

title: Aldi joins Asda and Morrisons in fruit and veg limits
description: The supermarket says it is introducing limits because of shortages of certain produce.

title: Serial killer fan Shaye Groves jailed for murdering boyfriend
description: Shaye Groves is told she will serve a minimum of 23 years for the murder last year.

title: PMQs: Rishi Sunak sidesteps questions on NI protocol deal
description: Asked if MPs will get a vote on any deal, the PM says Parliament will be able to "express its view".

title: Finn Russell: Scotland star's rise from pre-match burger and chips to Six Nations' top fly-half
description: Scotland fly-half Finn Russell opens up to BBC Radio 5 Live's Rugby Union Daily about his idiosyncratic journey to becoming one of the world's top players.

title: What's behind the fruit and veg shortages?
description: Supply issues have led Asda and Morrisons supermarkets to limit sales of fresh produce.

title: Nicola Bulley: Inquest opens into death in Lancashire
description: The 45-year-old's body was found in a Lancashire river on Sunday after a search of over three weeks.

title: Search and rescue mission launched after coal mine collapses in China
description: Chinese state news agency Xinhua is reporting that one person has been rescued alive so far.

title: Tube strike: London Underground drivers to walk out on Budget Day
description: Tube drivers are striking in a dispute over pensions and working arrangements, the union Aslef says.

title: Mystery sphere found on beach perplexes Japan
description: Authorities say the object is not a threat, but it remains the subject of much speculation.

title: Broadband must be accessible to all, peers told
description: Experts tell a House of Lords committee too many families cannot afford this "essential utility".

title: Aardman animation teaches UK school kids about child refugees
description: The four minute film is made by the studio behind Wallace and Gromit and will be shown in schools.

title: Teacher stabbed to death by pupil in France: reports
description: A teacher has been fatally stabbed in a school in south-west France, local media reports.

title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle dismiss South Park lawsuit rumour
description: A spokesperson for the royal couple reportedly said claims of a lawsuit are "totally baseless" and "boring".

title: British Steel plans to close ovens and cut 260 jobs
description: The Chinese-owned company says it is proposing cuts at its Scunthorpe site due to economic challenges.

title: Shamima Begum bid to regain UK citizenship rejected
description: The 23-year-old loses her appeal against the decision to remove her citizenship on national security grounds.

title: Anderson returns to top of Test bowling rankings at 40
description: England's leading wicket-taker James Anderson ends Australia captain Pat Cummins' four-year reign as the leading Test bowler in the world.

title: Liverpool 2-5 Real Madrid: Jurgen Klopp says Champions League last-16-tie 'is over'
description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp says 'at the moment' he feels that his side's Champions League last-16 tie against Real Madrid is already over, after the European champions won 5-2 at Anfield.

title: Train firms sorry after information systems outage
description: National Rail says some systems, including journey planners, have been fixed after an earlier fault.

title: JK Rowling dismisses backlash over trans comments: 'I don't care about my legacy'
description: The author says she isn't worried about how the backlash over her views will affect her legacy.

title: Ted Lasso's Hannah Waddingham to co-host Eurovision
description: The Emmy-award winner will be joined in Liverpool by Graham Norton, Julia Sanina and Alesha Dixon.

title: BBC India: MPs call Delhi and Mumbai searches 'intimidation'
description: BBC premises in Delhi and Mumbai were searched by tax authorities last week.

title: 'His dad cut off the cast and he made a hundred' - tracing Stokes' Kiwi roots
description: As Ben Stokes prepares to play a Test in Wellington, the city he called home for two years, Stephan Shemilt traces the England captain's cricketing roots in New Zealand.

title: How Russia's 35-mile armoured convoy ended in failure
description: How Russia's plan to overthrow Ukraine's government ended in embarrassing failure.

title: Six Nations 2023: Deadline day arrives for Wales v England match in Cardiff
description: The decision on whether Wales' Six Nations match against England goes ahead reaches the Wednesday deadline set by Welsh players.

title: How Ukraine's children are coping, one year on
description: As the first anniversary of Russia's invasion nears, Newsround reporter Ricky Boleto spent a week in Ukraine to talk to children about the impact the conflict is having on them.

title: Newspaper headlines: Putin 'rips up treaty' and fruit and veg rationing
description: Wednesday's papers focus on the latest in the Ukraine conflict as well as UK supermarket shortages.

title: Starbucks launches olive oil coffee drinks in Italy
description: The world's biggest coffee chain entered the Italian market in 2018 and has around 20 stores in the country.

title: Biden administration proposes strict asylum restrictions at border
description: The plan was swiftly denounced by pro-migrant groups, who likened it to Trump-era policies.

title: Australia has taken out 'hive' of spies, security chief says
description: Mike Burgess says Australia is being targeted by foreign intelligence like never before.

title: King Charles coronation: 'We want bell-ringers in every church'
description: Campanologists preparing for the King's coronation are encouraging others to take up the pursuit.

title: My Money: 'I have 25p left in my bank account'
description: Alannah, a 27-year-old blogger from Scotland, shares her weekly spending diary.

title: PS VR2: Sony's next attempt to make virtual reality gaming mainstream
description: PlayStation has released its updated virtual reality headset for the PS5.

title: Russians in Putin's chokehold turn a blind eye to war
description: Most prefer to let the Kremlin get on with its war, but keeping their heads down means moral compromises.

title: 'I can't bear his blood in me' - sex abuser's daughter
description: Jenny Pearson did not know the extent of her father's abuse until broadcaster Nicky Campbell spoke out.

title: Royal Navy F-35 pilot tells of ejecting seconds before crash
description: The Royal Navy officer says the £100m jet was going to roll off HMS Queen Elizabeth after it lost power.

title: Heat pumps: Lords slam 'failing' green heating scheme
description: Government unlikely to meet its green heating targets as take-up of the grant scheme is so low.

title: Social care costs see thousands chased for debt
description: More than 60,000 people in England faced debt collection over home care last year, BBC research finds.

title: US diplomat on what it's like negotiating with Putin
description: John Sullivan, the former US ambassador to Russia, says talks to prevent the war were "a charade".

title: Liverpool 2-5 Real Madrid: 'Slapstick' defending in heavy defeat leaves Reds facing inquest
description: Jurgen Klopp accepts it will be a 'massive challenge' to reach the Champions League quarter-finals after 'slapstick' defending in their 5-2 first-leg defeat at home to Real Madrid.

title: SNP leadership: The perils of mixing politics and faith
description: Scotland Editor James Cook examines the fall out from Kate Forbes' comments on gay marriage.

title: PM urged to help save struggling gyms and pools
description: A coalition of almost 200 sports governing bodies, health organisations and top athletes writes to UK prime minister Rishi Sunak asking for help.

title: Russian women explain why they chose to give birth in Argentina
description: Thousands of pregnant Russians travel to Argentina despite having no links to the country.

title: Yaroslav Amosov on fighting Russia, defending Ukraine and facing Logan Storley
description: As bombs fell, Yaroslav Amosov hid his prized belt in a basement. He thought the war meant the end of his fighting career - instead, it is the reason for his return.
